info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:22AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 745 AM EDT... At 722 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Steubenville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moon Township, Weirton, Steubenville, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Wellsville, Wellsburg, Robinson Township, Economy, Ambridge, Coraopolis, Toronto, Beaver, Calcutta, Wintersville, Sewickley, Ohioville, Mingo Junction, Harmony Township, and Follansbee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 66 and 67. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 33 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
